meanings.definition: Made a harsh, high-pitched sound when opening or moving, as a door or floorboard.
meanings.sent1: The old door creaked loudly when I opened it.
meanings.sent2: The floorboard creaked under my weight as I walked across the room.
meanings.sent3: The creaking door startled the cat, making it jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The creaking sound of the door was like a ghost whispering in the night.
meanings.sent5: The creaking noise of the floorboard echoed through the empty house.

meanings.definition: Uttered a harsh, high-pitched sound, as a door or floorboard.
meanings.sent1: She creaked out a warning as the door slowly opened.
meanings.sent2: The old wooden stairs creaked with each step he took.
meanings.sent3: The creaking floorboard seemed to mock him as he tiptoed across the room.
meanings.sent4: Her voice creaked with age, but her words were full of wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The creaking noise of the door made her shiver with fear.

meanings.definition: To make a harsh, high-pitched sound, as a door or floorboard.
meanings.sent1: The hinges creaked as the door swung open slowly.
meanings.sent2: The wooden chair creaked as he sat down heavily on it.
meanings.sent3: The creaking floorboard seemed to have a mind of its own, protesting every step.
meanings.sent4: The old ship creaked and groaned as it battled against the stormy sea.
meanings.sent5: The creaking sound of the door filled the room with an eerie atmosphere.
